data.title: Barbara Bain: husband, daughter, net worth, movies and TV shows
data.meta_description: BARBARA BAIN is an award-winning American actress. Check out this article to know more about her husband, daughter, net worth, movies and television shows.
data.text:
During her peak in Hollywood, Barbara Bain headlined many television shows of yesteryears. She was there when the film industry went through drastic changes and even introduced her followers to the spy craze of the 1960s. Barbara was one of the females who took charge, broke down barriers, and transformed Hollywood into what people know it today. Six decades later since she made her acting debut, Bain is still going strong and has shown no signs of stopping.

Barbara Bain is an award-winning American actress best known for her role as Cinnamon Carter in the 1966 action television show Mission: Impossible. Her portrayal of Cinnamon Carter won her three Primetime Emmy Awards and received a Golden Globe Award nomination.

Bain has also appeared in many other television shows, including Space: 1999 (1975–1977), Walker, Texas Ranger (1998), and the classic 1957 legal drama series Perry Mason. Although Barbara Bain may not be the fresh face in Hollywood as she once was, her legacy and contributions to the entertainment industry remain timeless.

Barbara Bain’s profile summary

Celebrated name: Barbara Bain

Birth name: Mildred Fogel

Gender: Female

Date of birth: 13 September 1931

Birth sign: Virgo

Place of birth: Chicago, Illinois, United States

Age: 90

Nationality: American

Ethnicity: White

Eye colour: Grey

Hair colour: Blonde

Weight: 55 Kilograms

Height: 1.76 metres (5 feet 9 inches)

Body measurements: 34-27-36 inches

Sexual orientation: Straight

Religion: Jewish

Marital status: Divorced

Children: 2 (Juliet Landau, Susan Landau Finch)

Education: University of Illinois

Profession: Actress, dancer, model

Years active: 1957-present

Twitter: @TheBarbaraBain

Early life

Barbara Bain was born Mildred Fogel on 13 September 1931 (age 90) in Chicago, Illinois, United States. Her parents were Russian Jewish who immigrated to the United States. She grew up in Chicago, Illinois, where she experienced her childhood. She attended college at the University of Illinois and graduated with a Bachelor’s Degree in Sociology.

After her graduation, Bain developed an interest in dance. She moved to New York City to fulfil her dreams and even took on a dance class. But dancing did not advance her career as she had wished. As a result, she became a model.

Mildred had a short stint in modelling. She took on another bold step while young to study acting at the Theater Studio and later progressed to the Actors Studio, allowing her to become an actress.

Family, husband, children

When Barbara Bain left Chicago for New York City to study acting, she met actor, producer, and cartoonist Martin James Landau at the Actors Studio. Initially, both Barbara and Martin had different impressions of each other’s characters, with Barbara portraying him as arrogant and stupid, while Martin thought of her as an empty-headed model.

Barbara Bain and Martin Landau got married in 1957. They worked together on several television shows, including Mission: Impossible and Space: 1999. The couple shared two children (daughters), Susan Landau Finch and Juliet Landau.

But in 1992, Barbara and Martin divorced. They had shared 35 years of marriage, with Mildred describing it as half good and half not so good. But in the end, she had enough. After the divorce, Barbara never remarried.

Professional career

Mildred Bain did not start her career as an actress. Instead, she worked as a dancer but was never satisfied with it. That forced her to change to modelling. In the early 1950s, model Barbara Bain partnered with Vogue, Harper's, and other publications. But, unfortunately, modelling as a career did not satisfy her either.

Mildred was working as a model and dancer while living in Chicago. Then, she left Chicago for New York City to study acting. After studying for one and half years, actress Barbara Bain started working on Broadway, and her first role was in the drama film Middle of the Night. At that time, Middle of the Night was on a tour of 26 cities.

The tour landed Mildred in Los Angeles, California, alongside her husband, Martin Landau. California proved to be a land of entertainment, and she soon found herself working on some of the most popular television shows of the fifties.

Barbara’s first appearance on TV was in 1958 when she played Mary Owens in the American adventure/drama series Harbourmaster. In 1959, Mildred appeared in many television shows as a guest, including Mike Hummer, Philip Marlowe, Richard Diamond, Private Detective, Alcoa Theatre, Tightrope, and more.

In 1960, Mildred Bain played Madelyn in the legal drama series Perry Mason. Between 1961 and 1965, Bain made many appearances in TV shows on minor roles or as a guest. She even appeared in Perry Mason in 1964 but portraying a different character named Elayna Scott. After eight years of working as a TV actress, Mildred Bain never landed a significant role.

That all changed in 1966 when she portrayed Cinnamon Carter in the television series Mission: Impossible. She played a role perfectly for three seasons between 1966 and 1969 and appeared in 78 episodes. Because of her excellent character portrayal, Bain won three Emmy Awards in a row, 1967, 1968, and 1969 for Outstanding Continued Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role in a Dramatic Series.

Although actress Mildred Bain was excellent during her prime, it took her 31 years to make her first appearance in a film. She starred as Mary Casal in the crime film Trust Me. She also appeared in other movies, including Skinheads (1989), Animals with the Tollkeeper (1998), Panic (2000), Forget Me Not (2009), and more. Other Barbara Bain's movies and TV shows of the 2010s and 2020s include:

Silver Skies (2016)

Code Black (2016)

On the Rocks (2020)

Interestingly, between 1991 and 2021, Barbara Bain has only appeared in only 13 TV shows. Also, she has made appearances in only 24 movies since she started her career as an actress more than 60 years ago.

Barbara Bain's net worth

Barbara Bain has been active in the entertainment industry for 64 years. She has worked as a model, actress, and singer, earning a salary and getting endorsements over the years. However, her official net worth remains unknown.

Barbara Bain's fast facts

What is Barbara Bain doing now? Barbara Bain continues to work as an actress in 2021. Her last appearance in a film was in 2020, when she portrayed Gran Keane in the comedy-drama movie On the Rocks. Also, in 2020, she appeared in the TV show Space Command playing Aunt Simone.

Is Barbara Bain still alive? Barbara Bain is still alive in 2021. She will make an appearance western film Something Happened: The Untold Story of Mice and Men portraying The Widow.

Does Barbara Bain have a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame? Barbara Bain has a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame installed on 28 April 2016.

How many Emmy Awards has Barbara Bain won? Bain has won three Emmy Awards, which she received in a row. She became the first actress in television history to receive three consecutive Emmy Awards (1967, 1968, 1969).

Where does Barbara Bain live? Since August 2012, Bain has resided in the Miracle Mile area of Los Angeles, California, United States.

Is Barbara Bain a teacher? She is currently a member of the Actors Studio West, where she teaches classes and performs scene work.

Barbara Bain is an award-winning American actress and former model and dancer. She started her career in 1957 and rose to fame in 1966 when she played Cinnamon Carter in the action TV series Mission Impossible. At 90 years of age, Barbara is still active in Hollywood and will appear in a western classic in 2021. On a personal level, Barbara has two daughters, Juliet Landau and Susan Landau Finch, with whom she shares with her late and ex-husband Martin Landau.
